No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-4A-4 - Enactment of an ordinance to annex an unincorporated island or any portion thereof. The mayor and council will consider the enactment of an ordinance to annex an unincorporated island or any portion thereof at the next regular meeting of the mayor and council following the public hearing referred to above. The mayor and council may review, or have reviewed by staff, any modifications to the proposed annexation prepared as a consequence of the public hearing or public comments. In enacting any proposed ordinance to annex an unincorporated island or any portion thereof, the mayor and council shall apply the standards and factors enumerated in Section 1-8 of this Ordinance, as well as the future development map and policies for the City and Ringgold urban area as contained in the current and adopted comprehensive plan of the City. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-5 - Process for amending zoning standards and procedures, zoning ordinance and/or zoning map. This ordinance, the zoning ordinance and/or the zoning map may be amended from time to time and a conditional use may be established only in accordance with the following procedure: (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-5.1 - Initiating applications for amendment. Amendments to this ordinance, the zoning ordinance and/or zoning map must be initiated by either the mayor and council, the Commission, or sixty (60) percent of the property owners owning not less than sixty (60) percent of the total affected lands. The interest of a property owner may be represented by a person holding a written power-of-attorney for the property owner. Consideration for conditional use permits must be initiated by the property owner or any person holding written power-of-attorney for the property owner(s). (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-5.2 - Advisory recommendation required; written application. Except as provided in Section 1-4.1 of this Ordinance, a zoning decision shall not become effective until the amendment or application for a conditional use or annexation shall first be submitted to the Commission for review, public hearing, and advisory recommendation. All amendments shall be initiated by a written application submitted to the Commission through its professional staff member(s) upon forms provided by the Commission. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-5.3 - Administrative fee required. At time of submission of any application for a zoning decision, the applicant shall pay the required administrative fee then in effect pursuant to resolution of the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-6 - Notice of public hearing on proposed zoning decision. Public notice shall be given of a public hearing on any proposed zoning decision as hereinafter provided. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-6.1 - Time frame for public notice. No less than fifteen (15) days but not more than forty-five (45) days before the date set for public hearing, notice shall be given to the general public of the proposed zoning decision stating the date, time, place, and purpose of the public hearing. The notice shall be published in the legal organ for Catoosa County, Georgia. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-6.2 - Content of public notice. Where the proposed zoning amendment requests the rezoning of property or the initial zoning of property to be annexed or consideration of a conditional use these additional procedures are applicable: (a) The published notice shall include the location of the property and state the current zoning classification of the property and the proposed zoning classification of the property, if applicable; (b) If a matter that constitutes a zoning decision is initiated by a party other than the mayor and council, a sign, not less than 17 inches by 24 inches, shall be placed by staff of the Commission in a conspicuous location on the property sought to be rezoned and/or considered for annexation or conditional use permit setting forth the date, time, place, and purpose of the public hearing, the present zoning classification of the property, if applicable, and the proposed classification or conditional use of the property, as applicable. Acts of vandalism or natural occurrence diminishing the effectiveness of notice by the sign posted on the property shall not invalidate any proceeding of final action taken on the proposed zoning decision. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7 - Conduct of public hearings. The Commission and the Mayor and Council shall each conduct a separate public hearing on any proposed zoning decision other than as provided in Sections 1-4 and 1-4A of this Ordinance. Although the planning commission will convene a public hearing on each proposal, the official public hearing will be held by the city council. The public hearings shall be conducted on the date and at the time and place specified by the Commission and the Mayor and Council. The purpose of such public hearings is to enable the proponent of the zoning decision to present the proposal before the general public and to receive comments on the proposed zoning decision from interested persons and the general public. The Commission and the Mayor and Council shall consider germane comments presented by the proponent of the zoning decision and by interested persons and the general public at such public hearing prior to the Commission making its advisory recommendation to the mayor and council, and the Mayor and Council shall consider the same and the recommendation of the Commission prior to making a final zoning decision. Zoning standards and factors as enumerated in Section 1-8 or Section 1-9 of this Ordinance, as applicable, shall be applied by the Commission and the Mayor and Council in making its advisory recommendation to the mayor and council and the final zoning decision, respectively. The Commission and the Mayor and Council shall prescribe rules of order for its conduct of public hearings pursuant to this section and shall be consistent with the general requirements and purposes set forth in this Ordinance and the general laws of the State of Georgia concerning the conduct of proceedings by municipal authorities. The following procedures (Section 1-7.1 through Section 1-7.9) shall govern the conduct of hearings and other proceedings before the Commission and the Mayor and Council, and the reference to the Chairman of the Commission shall also be applicable to the mayor or his designee in conducting the public hearing before the Mayor and Council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.1 - Public hearing procedures. The Chairman of the Commission or his designee on the Commission (hereinafter either may be referred to as the "Chairman") shall open any public hearing with an explanation of the purpose for the public hearing and a description of the general rules of the Commission for conducting the public hearing. Any individual requesting to be heard on the matter germane to the purpose of the public hearing must be recognized by the Chairman before addressing the Commission. Whether any comment or presentation to the Commission is germane to the public hearing shall be the sole determination of the Chairman. The Chairman is authorized to rule any person or any portion of any person's presentation out of order and not germane to the published purpose of the public hearing. Any person addressing the Commission, upon being recognized by the Chairman, shall give his/her name and residence address before making any comment, remark, or presentation. Any person addressing the Commission shall respond to questions from any member of the Commission. The Chairman may pre-determine the length of any hearing and shall allot equal time to proponents and opponents of any proposed zoning amendment and/or conditional use for presentation of data, evidence, and opinion. The fact that equal time is not in fact used by either the proponents or opponents shall not invalidate any proceeding or final action taken on the proposed amendment and/or conditional use. Provided, however, that the proponents and opponents of the issue before the Commission shall be allowed a minimum aggregate time period of not less than ten (10) minutes per side for the presentation of data, evidence or opinion. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.2 - Application confirmed and identified. The Chairman shall determine whether any application for zoning amendment or conditional use is properly initiated and the type of zoning decision called for by the application. The Chairman shall announce at the outset of any public hearing whether the application is in proper order for consideration by the Commission. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.3 - Presentation of zoning proposal. The Chairman shall allow the proponent of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use to provide an explanation or description of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use and the reason(s) for initiating the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The presence of an annexation applicant at the public hearing is not required, unless the petition was filed using the sixty (60) percent method or the zone district requested in the annexation application requires the presentation and approval of a site plan. However, the applicant for a proposed zoning amendment or conditional use, or his attorney at law or in fact, must be present at the public hearing to present the merits of the application. The failure of an applicant or his legal representative to attend the public hearing will result in the Commission making an unfavorable advisory recommendation on the application to the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.4 - Documents accepted for the record. The Chairman shall enter into the record the contents of any pertinent written comment, petition or written statement, plat, photograph or other documentary evidence received by the Commission in support of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. Such written comments, petitions or other documentary evidence or exhibits shall be considered a part of the record by the Commission and may be considered by the Commission in making its advisory recommendation to the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.5 - Cross presentation. The Chairman shall then permit persons opposed to the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use an opportunity to address the Commission in the public hearing in accordance with the rules of the Commission and the allocation of time announced at the commencement of the public hearing. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.6 - Procedure for public remarks. The Chairman may alternate the presentation of persons speaking in favor or in opposition to the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use beginning with the presentation of the proponent or his/her attorney at law or in fact, or the Chairman may divide such presentation into blocks of time beginning with the proponents of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use and moving thereafter to the presentation of the opponents of the proposed zoning amendment. Further, the Chairman may direct that the proponents and opponents designate one or more spokesperson(s) for the presentation of views on a proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The Chairman may poll the public assemblage at the hearing concerning the concurrence and/or opposition with remarks of any person addressing the Commission at the public hearing. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.7 - Prohibition of certain remarks; power to remove. Any remark amounting to an attack on the character or personal integrity of another person, not actually supportable in law or fact, or in the form of an emotional outburst shall be deemed non-germane to the purpose of public hearing and shall be ruled out of order. The Commission shall have the power to remove from the hearing room or censor any person who continues to make such non-germane remarks after being ruled out of order. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.8 - Rebuttal. Upon conclusion of the presentation of persons opposing the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use, the Chairman shall offer the proponent of the zoning amendment or proponent's designee a specified amount of time to address the Commission in rebuttal of any issue raised by persons addressing the Commission in opposition to the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The Chairman shall rule out of order any new issue raised in rebuttal unless deemed useful to the Commission in evaluating the merits of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. If a new issue is allowed to be raised by rebuttal then persons opposing the proposed zoning amendment shall be allotted an equal amount of time through one or more spokesperson(s) to address the new issue(s). (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-7.9 - Close of the public hearing. When proponents and opponents of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use have been heard in accordance with the foregoing procedure, the Chairman shall declare the public hearing closed. No further public hearing on the issue shall be required prior to the advisory recommendation of the Commission to the mayor and council or prior to the taking of final action on the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use by the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-8 - Zoning amendment standards. Exercise of zoning power by the mayor and council shall constitute an effort to balance the interest of the City in promoting the public health, safety, morality, and/or general welfare against the right of property owners to the unrestricted use of their property. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-8.1 - Factors for consideration in zoning decision. The following factors are determined to be relevant in balancing the interests in promoting the public health, safety, morality, and/or general welfare against the right to unrestricted use of property: a) Whether the proposed amendment would allow a use that is generally suitable for the site compared to other possible uses and the uses and zoning of adjacent and nearby properties. b) Whether the proposed amendment would adversely affect the economic value or the uses of adjacent, abutting, and nearby properties. c) Whether the extent to which the destruction or diminishing of the value of the lot or parcel proposed for zoning amendment promotes the health, safety, morals, or general welfare of the public. d) Whether the property to be affected by the proposed amendment can be used as currently zoned considering the suitability of the subject lot or parcel for the proposed zoned purposes. e) Whether the relative gain to the general public, as compared to the hardship imposed upon the owner of the subject lot or parcel under the current zoning substantially promotes the general welfare of the public. f) The length of time the property has been vacant as zoned, considered in the context of land development in the area and in the vicinity of the proposed land to be rezoned. g) Whether the lot or parcel sought to be rezoned/annexed under the proposed amendment is in conformity or divergence with the policy and intent of the adopted Joint Comprehensive Plan/equivalent, as amended. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-8.2 - Applicability of the comprehensive plan and law. The mayor and council and the Commission, in its advisory recommendation to the Mayor and council, shall consider the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use in light of the factors set forth in Section 1-8 or Section 1-9, as applicable. In evaluating the factors set forth in Section 1-8 it shall be the policy of the City to exercise its zoning power in conformity with the adopted policies and intent of the current and adopted comprehensive plan of the City, insofar as the plan is current in its application to development patterns in the area sought to be zoned or rezoned. The policy of the City is to exercise its zoning power for purposes of assuring the compatibility of usage of adjacent and nearby properties and the preservation of the economic value of adjacent and nearby properties, while enabling a use of all properties measured by the U.S. Constitution and the Georgia Constitution. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-9 - Conditional use (special use) standards. The granting of a conditional use does not constitute a permanent change in zoning or use. The conditional use can be forfeited if it does not meet the review criteria. To ameliorate the impact of a conditional use on surrounding property, no conditional use may be granted without special provisions for conditions, criteria, standards, and/or requirements as to the particular use. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-9.1 - Factors for consideration of conditional uses. A permit for a conditional use (special use) shall be approved or denied, provided that due consideration is given to the following objective factors as applicable to the specific use proposed at the specific site requested and the subjective consideration of Section 1-8.2 of this Ordinance. a) Whether the proposed use will be consistent with the comprehensive plan for the physical development of the district, including any master plan or portion thereof adopted by the commission; b) Whether the proposed use will be in harmony with the general character of the neighborhood considering population density, design, scale and bulk of any proposed new structures, intensity and character of activity, traffic and parking conditions; c) Whether the proposed use will not be detrimental to the use, peaceful enjoyment, economic value, or development of surrounding properties or the general neighborhood and will cause not objectionable noise, vibrations, fumes, odors, dust, glare, or physical activity, nor will be injurious or likely to create a nuisance; d) Whether the proposed use will not adversely affect the health, safety, security, morals, or general welfare or residents, visitor or workers in the area; and e) Whether the proposed use will be served by adequate public services and facilities including schools, police and fire protection, water, sanitary sewers, public roads, storm drainage, and other public improvements. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-10 - Procedure for consideration of proposed action. The procedure for considering any proposed zoning amendment or conditional use that is properly initiated and subsequent to the required public hearing shall be as follows: (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-10.1 - Advisory recommendation. The Commission shall make an advisory recommendation to the mayor and council as to the adoption of any proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The recommendation of the Commission shall be in writing and addressed to the mayor and council and will clearly state the Commission's recommendation on the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The Commission's recommendation shall provide evaluation of each of the factors set forth in Section 1-8 or 1-9, as applicable, and describe how the Commission's recommendation is consistent with those factors for the exercise of the zoning power of the City. A summary of the proceedings of the public hearing or transcript thereof along with the record of the proceeding before the Commission shall accompany the Commission's written recommendation to the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-10.2 - Advisory recommendation content; time limit; withdrawal. Upon conclusion of the public hearing before the Commission, the Commission may make a recommendation to either approve, disapprove, or table the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. If consideration of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use is tabled, it shall be reconsidered by the Commission not later than sixty (60) days after the close of the public hearing. If the Commission tables their recommendation, then the scheduled public hearing of the mayor and council may continue, however the mayor and council shall await the recommendation of the commission before taking final action. The rules of the Commission shall provide for a regular monthly meeting during each calendar month. If no advisory recommendation is submitted to the mayor and council within sixty (60) days of the close of the public hearing on any zoning amendment or conditional use, the Commission shall be deemed to have made a favorable recommendation of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. The application for zoning amendment or conditional use shall not be withdrawn once the Commission opens and conducts the public hearing. The Commission shall make a recommendation to the mayor and council on the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use regardless whether the proponent of the zoning amendment or conditional use attempts to, thereafter, withdraw his/her application of the zoning amendment or conditional use. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-10.3 - Official action; conditions. The Commission's authority in any zoning decision shall only be advisory. All zoning decisions shall be made by the mayor and council and it shall either approve or disapprove the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, any approval of a proposed zoning amendment or conditional use may be subject to any and all lawful conditions that may be required by the mayor and council as a condition of the approval of the proposed zoning amendment or conditional use. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-10.4 - Restriction on reapplication. If the mayor and council takes any official action disapproving a proposed zoning amendment or conditional use that same tract or parcel of land may not be considered as part of any future application until six (6) months have expired from the date of final action of the mayor and council. (Ord. No. 2014-0324, § 1, 3-24-14) Section 1-11 - Availability of this ordinance. Copies of this Ordinance, as amended, shall be printed by the City and made available for distribution of the general public in the office of the City Clerk, and the office of the Code Enforcement Officer of the City. Distribution to any member of the general public shall be upon request of such person who shall be entitled to one copy. The city clerk is authorized to print copies of this Ordinance from time to time for purposes of compliance with the requirements of Georgia law. This ordinance may also be viewed at the official city website or a link thereof. (Ord.
